snippet: In solving a mystery, scientists discovered cancer cells with the same DNA in clams from all over the East Coast, but with no DNA from the host.
abstract: Study in journal Cell finds that leukemia-like cancer infecting clams along East Coast of United States spreads through sea water; is only third transmissible cancer found to date in nature.
lead_paragraph: In solving a mystery, scientists discovered cancer cells with the same DNA in clams from all over the East Coast, but with no DNA from the host.

headline.print_headline: Marine Life: Clam Cancer, Spread by One Set of Cells
headline.main: A Clam Cancer Outbreak, Spread by One Set of Cells
